data.title: Don't order the steaks
data.text: My wife and I went here for a nice evening out. She ordered filet I ordered the ribeye. Both steaks were undercooked and tough. Since I often grill steaks I could tell these were poor cuts of meat priced as premium choice beef. If you are a steak lover you will be very disappointed.

data.title: Highly overpriced restaurant
data.text: I have to use 100 characters to let you know not to waste, WASTE your money at this overpriced Nuevo cuisine wanna-be restaurant.

data.title: nice meal
data.text:
Went here with group of 8 - although I made reservations to make sure we would have a table, they didn't have it, but fit us in anyway.
Food very good, from appetizers to main course - we only looked at dessert menu.
We had a variety of orders, from filet (very good) to a whole sea bass (good) to pastas (good) and short rib (very good). Would recommend the filet and certain pastas!
Service very good and friendly.

data.title: FANTASTIC
data.text: LOVED EVERYTHING!!!  Went there with my husband and children and they were great!  My husband had the ribeye and I had the halibut.  Both were superior quality and flavor.  Kids food was perfect and staff even knew to bring my kids food early!!  The waitress took my kids back into the kitchen to let them make their own dessert!  WHAT????  That's awesome they won't stop talking about it and it gave my husband and I some very rare alone time!   The meal, staff, and ambience were great...however the best part was the wine and cocktail selection....I had a pimm and proper craft cocktail and my husband a Nucky Thompson followed by sharing a bottle of wine!  The selection is big and diverse with all types and price ranges kept in mind.  Our waitress recommended an EXCELLENT bottle for only $45(if you see Kay)...now that's service.  Thanks Zazios you did great.  We will be back!!

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so happy you had a great meal and experience with our Zazios family. We can't wait to see you back!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Back since redesign and new menu
data.text: The food was different from before, but still excellent. We had Salmon ($24), Lobster ravioli ($28), quinoa salad ($18) and tiramisu ($8). Everything was shared and delicious. Total price w/o drinks was $78.00 before tax.

data.title: Had not been in awhile
data.text: This was my first time back in about 2 years.  I took my four young children.  All of us loved our meal.  I order steak and it was great.  One of my kids ordered pork chops.  They were even better.  I will return and order the chops for myself.

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Happy to hear you had a great experience. We can't wait to have you back!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Impressive & Highly Recommended
data.text:
I am slowly working my way through the top Kalamazoo restaurants on the T.A. list of highly rated, as mentioned in other reviews, and it was time for Zazios.

I really did not know what to expect going in, as it seemed like a higher end place from my walk by's going to Burdicks and alike downtown. They open at 5 on a Saturday and we were there at open so it was not really busy. 

We had the fire roasted vegetable soup, their caesar salad for the first part of the meal. The GF ordered the chicken, and I had the rigatoni. All of that was incredible we both thought. The quality and presentation was excellent. We sat out on the patio, as the weather was nice and Ribfest was going on downtown so we could people watch as well. 

At the end of our meal, I asked if they had Creme Brulee available. I was stuffed, and we took half the food home as it was a LOT of food. However, I never miss a chance to try some Creme Brulee when we find it. Anyway, they said they did not have it on their menu, but........ they would "go upstairs" and get us some. 

Whaaaa?!!??!? Unheard of service. 

Anyway, the dessert was also delicious. While the price tag is high, I can honestly say out of the many places we have eaten local and around the country, this is one of the VERY FEW that I would say is worth that price tag. Every part of the meal was delicious with plenty to take home. 

Highly recommended.

data.title: Dinner place
data.text: Visited this establishment several times with large groups for dinners. Excellent service, pretty decent menu and not overpriced.

data.title: Changes not for the better
data.text: Our recent meal was the first one since the restaurant was remodeled and a new chef was hired. The quality of the food has drastically changed. The pasta dishes were soggy and tasteless. The amount of seafood in the pasta dish was a very small portion with mussels the size of a dime. When the waitress was questioned about the truffle french fries she admitted it had truffle oil not truffles. The fillet of beef was tough. The waitress was poorly trained. She interrupted and tried to enter our private conversation. We took special guests from the East Coast to dine and had to apologized about the food that was expensive and definitely not worth it. The present Zazios is crossed off our list.

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with your meal and experience at Zazios. I have let our Chef know about your concerns with the dishes so we can make sure it doesn't happen in the future. If you have any specific food related questions or feedback please feel free to email Chef Joe directly at jpearson@ghgkz.com. We thank you for your feedback and please feel free to email me directly at bdepauw@ghgkz.com so we can make sure your next experience with us is flawless.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hmmm
data.text: Came for Italian.  Not sure what I got. Menu is somewhat limited.  Food was decent. Atmosphere was contemporary. Service was good. Honestly, not sure what to think. Check the menu online before you go.

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We have recently switched from a focus on Italian cuisine to flavors from all over the world using local ingredients. Our menu is now inspired by the whole world and not just Italy. Please feel free to contact Chef Joe, directly at jpearson@ghgkz.com  with any food related questions or concerns you may have. He will also be able assist you in finding a more traditional Italian dish on our menu. Thank you for your feedback and please let me know if there is anything I can do for you by contacting me directly at bdepauw@ghgkz.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Dining Experience
data.text: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here. We had a very enjoyable experience. Highly recommend for special occasions.

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Happy Anniversary! Thanks for letting us be apart of your special day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not good quality food
data.text: I ordered a seafood basket.  The food was freezer burnt and tasted terrible. The rest of the meal was average.  This was supposed to be a great evening out with great food.  Wasn't even close.  Didn't eat the meal.

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with your meal and experience at Zazios. I have let our Chef know about this issue so we can make sure it doesn't happen in the future. We thank you for your feedback and please let me know if there is anything we can do!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: My sixth visit
data.text: I have visited this restaurant several times and have pleased with the dining experience until this time.  I had a reservation and was seated promptly.  To me, the menu offerings were not as interesting as in the past.  I don't know if it was me or the restaurant , but I did not enjoy dining there.  I will go back next year when I am in town.

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your helpful feedback! I am sorry that the menu items weren't what you were hoping for. We would love to hear any suggestions or feedback about the menu you have for us.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food, poor wine list
data.text:
While staying at the Radisson Plaza I stopped in at Zazio's for dinner. The food was very good. The home-made focaccia with truffle butter was an excellent start to the meal and the pulled pork with fresh cilantro, orange and other seasoning was very nice.

My one complaint was the wine list, which is pretty sparse, especially for wine by the glass. However, of the 3 restaurants in the Radisson plaza that I tried, BUrdick's Wesbter's and Zazio's, Zazio's was definitely my favorite and the one I would recommend

data.title: May be better
data.text: Zazio's has recently gotten a new menu. The staff is superbly trained so the service is great. The new decor is okay. The food?--not so much. My fish was dead raw in the middle. I was there with two other people and they agreed that their meals were below average. The desserts were great.  Since this is a new iteration of this restaurant I am hoping it will improve in a month or so.

owner_response.author: Brooke D, Public Relations Manager at Zazios, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry to hear about your disappointments with the meal. I have let our Chef know about these issues so we can make sure they do not happen in the future. Thank you for your feedback!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Meh
data.text: This place is over priced and smal portions. If you can afford it and you just want something small it's great if you want a real meal and not spend a lot go elsewhere our downtown area (I'm a lifelong native)  has dozens of places that are much better. I personally won't return.

data.title: We loved it!
data.text: We have one been to Zazio's once, which admittedly was a couple of years ago, but back then we had one of the best meals of our lives. The executive chef came out and spoke with us during our meal which made us feel valued and appreciated.My boyfriend ordered the porterhouse, which he said was the best steak he's ever had. I ordered some kind of pasta with mushrooms and prosciutto and it was absolutely divine. Of course we each got a slice of the tiramisu for dessert and were absolutely in heaven. If you don't get ANYTHING else here, do yourself a favor and get tiramisu. I understand Zazio's has revamped their restaurant and their menu and we haven't been here since they changed it, so I can't comment on the more current environment, but we both plan to go back when we have time so we can try it and compare.

data.title: Improved ambiance AND food.
data.text: We dined here last night after hearing that both the decor and menu had undergone revision.  The atmosphere is now less formal and more bistro-like.  In the past, we found the pastas mostly overcooked and the mains underwhelming.  Last night, however, we enjoyed the duck pastrami "sharable", bread with truffle butter, seafood etouffee bowl with Israeli couscous, and the seafood cannolli (which was not overcooked).  Martinis (limoncello and "smokey bleu") were quite good, and the tiramisu and chocolate turnover were yummy, as well. The only disappointment was the tuna (tough). The ambiance was nice, with relaxing music that was not too loud for conversation.  We shall return.

data.title: Love the new look and the food is delicious!
data.text: Was excited to see the new look after Zazios changed their look and their menu.  First, the new place looks fresh and very contemporary with the grey and red colors.  Also like the new bistro tables by the windows - looks very New York!  Second, the wine list is great and varied.  What I like about the menu is that you have a choice of having small plates to share with people of you can have a meal.  With the large meal, it is great as the price for each entrée is the same!  My sister and her husband had the steak and loved it as you get a vegetable and a starch with the meal.  They said the meal was amazing.  For me, I ordered the chicken and the meal was plentiful.  We all tried the minestrone soup and it was delicious!  It was a great dining experience and will go back again as the value of the meal is excellent.  Would highly recommend!

data.title: Unbelievable from start to finish!!
data.text: Having eaten there a few months ago and loving it when I heard they remodeled and changed the menu I had to go back.  My wife and I had the Duck appetizer which is smoked and served with flatbread, arugula salad, pickled red onions, and an amazing Apple jam.  Then she ordered the chicken fettuccine and I ordered the chicken quinoa.  Both dishes tasted just fantastic!!  For desert we finished with the Chef's Special which was a chocolate cake with candied pecans and hazelnuts with a scoop of Stout ice cream.  Together the bite was awesome.  The remodel also looks great, warm lighting, new seating areas, opened up around the bar, and also the entryway.  If you're looking for fantastic food, superior service, and a great night you should consider Zazio's as an option.
